content.description: Begin just right of arete under small roof. Pull roof to climb face, staying to right of arete. Follow right facing corner to top.
content.protection: A few bolts to top. Possible to setup top rope at top quite easily.

content.description: Stem, jam, and lay-back the detached pillar that forms a right-facing dihedral.  Surmount large block that sits atop the pillar.  Make delicate traverse right (crux, R) with gear at feet to dike with cracks.  Follow dike cracks to belay ledge with detached boulder.
content.location: The detached pillar that makes a crack-corner right of the gully.  The alcove 60' right of Stone Cutter's Bible.

content.description: One of the few easy moderates worth doing.  Climb cracks in the corner (perfect foot and hand jams are possible) up into a chimney.  Top out at tree ledge.
content.protection: Hand sized cams (BD 2-3) work well for the cracks in the bottom half.  The easy chimney is run out.

content.description: Climb ledges to the base of a finger crack, jam the crack with the difficulties coming mid way. A sweet obscure crack that deserves more attention
content.protection: Thin to hands. Cams work well, there are two pins of unknown age. Two bolt anchor at the top

content.description: Line of bolts in between Jailbait and House of Detention. Crimpy balancy climbing with hard moves near the top
content.location: Next to Jailbait and House of Detention

content.description: Climb an obvious right facing corner finishing in a juggy roof (beware loose blocks). Climb right at the roof and make a move to the bolted anchor.
content.protection: Rack to 2.5" + nuts. Doubles of 1" helpful
content.location: Route is just right of recent rockfall (2016) about 100 yards past Commander Salamander wall in the area known as the Hombre de Acero Wall.

content.description: As in, It's a mystery why anybody ever bolted it. As the new guide book says, "A tolerable warmup."
content.protection: Bolts all the way up, lower off the two big locking carabiners at the top.
content.location: Bolts directly to the right of Man-O-War

content.description:
This climb is part of an area the guidebook calls the "Outback Wall". Located left to the House of Detention wall, this area sees little traffic and as such is not the cleanest climbing on the island. Nevertheless, there are some fun, short climbs in this area and it's definitely worth exploring further.

 For this route you'll climb up to a large-ish first ledge where you can throw in a double knee-bar rest if you're feeling extra. Then follow cracks and ledges up a slight corner to the top of the cliff. Crux is getting through the ten feet of narrow cracks following the first ledge; after that it's pretty straightforward climbing to the top out to the right of the small tree. Anchor off of the large tree set well back from the top of the route; consider bringing static rope to extend the anchor out over the lip or a rope rug to save your rope from wear running over the lip.
content.protection: Small-medium cams, nuts. Use natural anchors at top (set well back from cliff-edge.
content.location:
Walk left of the house of detention wall for a short ways and past the obvious roof (guidebook calls this Grumble). The route begins just left of a small roof that is about 10 ft from the ground; look up and you'll see a small tree growing out of the top of the cliff, underneath a wide, slightly detached section. The route runs more or less up the cracks/small corner to the right.

 To set a toprope, either scramble up the obvious gully on the right side of the area (you'll see this walking in) or walk past where the cliffs run out where you'll encounter a hiking trail. Walking along the top of the cliff you'll come to a large tree that you can belay/TR off of.

content.description: The business starts right off the ground. Thin, technical, and sustained climbing for 3 bolts. After the 3rd bolt enjoy easier climbing on fun and interesting jugs. Get a jam in the victory hand crack that awaits you near the end!
content.protection: 5 bolts. 2-bolt anchor. Optional 2.5" gear placement between the 4th and 5th bolts.
content.location:
Located on the east face just right of the climber registry box at the top of the trail to Canada Cliffs. The first bolted route to the right of The Stonecutters Bible crack. 

  This route is easily toproped by climbing The Mystery Arete 5.10a to the right.

content.description: A vertical crimpy climb with the crux coming after the last bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts, use small cams or nuts to protect the upper portion.
content.location: Walk left along the bottom of the cliff from the Commander Salamander area.  Jailbait is the first line of bolts on the next section of cliff.

content.description: Begin at loose, left-arching flake to gain the 1st bolt. Move up and right to large overlap. Pull overlap and continue up steep face to top.
content.protection: A few bolts to anchors. Can be setup as top rope after a hairy access to ledge. Probably easiest to top out via a more moderate route.

content.description: Climb the the cracks that line the face. Steep, technical moves on good locks and the occasional good foot will see you through. One of the best crack climbs I’ve ever done!
content.protection: One piton and many small wires. Would take cams but they will take the locks.
content.location: On the open face to the left of Russian Revolution.

content.description: Start 5 feet left of the arete and climb the steep face. Move right to arete, using a short, finger crack to overcome the crux. Finish at tree ledge above.
content.protection: A few bolts to anchors. Possible to walk up around to top and via a short tree rappel setup quickdraws for top rope.

content.description: Left of House of Detention is this line that follows the line of weakness through two holes. Hard moves are encountered by the first bolt then sustained crimping after the rest. Cool route!
content.location: To the left of House of Detention

content.description: Start in the middle of the wall below a finger crack. Climb the slippery face to gain crack.
content.protection: Two pitons plus gear on the way to anchors.  Possible to walk around and easily setup a top rope with quick draws via anchors.

content.description: Right facing dihedral with a finger crack on left wall. Gradually steepens to slightly overhung, finish up the juggy face after the pin. One of the best routes on Canada Cliff for sure!
content.protection: Starts out around .5 C4 and narrows to blue or black aliens. After the crack there is some pro just look around.
content.location: Walk past Russian Revolution to talus then head up. Will be the first climb encountered.

content.description: On the far left of cliff, follow steep discontinuous crack to tree ledge.
